algorithms

Class LongestPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.LongestPath

  • public class LongestPath
extends java.lang.Object
    A version of a path builder that prefers the longest path between src and either destination node or back to itself. The algorithm is not currently optimal and is meant for use to quickly compare knots in closed curves. It may be improved over time as needed.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Set<PairInt> dest

      protected java.util.Set<PairInt> unVisited

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LongestPath() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<PairInt> findMaxCostPath(java.util.Set<PairInt> points, PairInt src, java.util.Set<PairInt> potentialDest)
      find the path that maximizes the cost from the source to one of the given destinations or the longest path if those destinations are not in the path (one use case is for a portion of a curve which may double back on itself and another is for a portion of a curve which continues from one side to the other and reaches the destination).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • findMaxCostPath

        public java.util.Set<PairInt> findMaxCostPath(java.util.Set<PairInt> points,
                                              PairInt src,
                                              java.util.Set<PairInt> potentialDest)
        find the path that maximizes the cost from the source to one of the given destinations or the longest path if those destinations are not in the path (one use case is for a portion of a curve which may double back on itself and another is for a portion of a curve which continues from one side to the other and reaches the destination). runtime is O(|V||E|).
        Returns:
